data.title: get the spicy chicken sandwich
data.text: Not many items on the menu, I like the spicy chicken sandwich better than the regular one.  Waffle fries are good.  The drive through route is a little awkward.

data.title: Yay for breakfast!
data.text:
I am gluten free for health reasons so I don't feel comfortable eating any of the food here. But I have gone through the drive-thru with other people enough times to be able to review this location.

The people working here are just the happiest, most helpful people ever. They will unquestioningly let you customize your order so you can get exactly the breakfast biscuit or sandwich that you want. And the food is great, though breakfast menu items tend to be better than the regular menu items.

I am envious of anyone who can eat here. So, eat the food; do it for me.

data.title: At last a Chick Fil A close to home
data.text: Friendly staffs, good food, clean vibe :) We have been waiting for a Chick Fil A close to us and finally it is here.

data.title: First visit to Chick-fil-A
data.text: First visit to Chick fil A - family fast food restaurant. I prefer the Chick-fil-A Chick-n-strips to the grilled chicken. The wedge potato fries were yummy.

data.title: good chick
data.text: enjoyed the chicken sandwich, the place was clean and the service was good.  get's really busy but they move you through.

data.title: Fast Lunch @ Chick fil A
data.text: It's a nice fast food restaurant which offers ample seating inside and take-out foods.  It's pretty new about 1 year since it opened last year.  There's ample parking and easy to get to.  The food is reasonable and better than most fast food places at reasonable prices.

data.title: Nice
data.text: Very nice food ,very good service,worth visiting .Best place in town fast food wise,esp sandwiches are healthy

data.title: Highly recommended.
data.text: I love this place, especially because is fast food but doesn't taste like that, is like gourmet and I felt like in a restaurant! all my congratulations to the owners.

data.title: Breakfast
data.text: Out for our morning breakfast. Not very busy in the am. We had the Oatmeal and fresh fruit cup and coffee. Lyn had breakfast burrito with chicken, hash rounds and coffee. Very good. Very clean and friendly place.

data.title: A bit more $, a bit more quality
data.text: I think that the chicken here is outstanding whether in a sandwich or a salad.  Yes, a bit more expensive than the other chains, but for a pleasant location with better quality we like it. And our son loves the smallish yet just right for him play structure.

data.title: Excellent service & food
data.text:
I only order the same thing every time I come here--something with grilled chicken & no wraps, and the results are consistently excellent.  ie, I avoid wraps and fried items.  For me, this place is therefore the chicken equivalent of In-N-Out Burger since I fixate on only a very few items on the menu, and it's always excellent and served by excellent service.  The price is on the order of Five Guys, but you get chicken here.  I don't order fried items (eg chicken strips) which is high probability for issues, no matter where you are.
Lemonade is the best I've had outside of home, but needs some dilution for my tastes.

data.title: Clean, quick, tasty!
data.text: This Chick fil A is right next to the new Courtyard Marriott in Sunnyvale.  This ended up being my go-to breakfast place as their spicy chicken biscuit is super delicious.  I never had to wait in the morning, and it was easy to get in, eat, and get out/on to my business for the day.

data.title: Just ok
data.text: Can't say for sure that it was caused by this place but I thought I might have eaten some bad chicken strip because I was sick throwing up the next morning after eating there and I haven't been sick like that in over 20 years. The strips had a weird soft texture and tasted a little funny. Scared to eat there now so I haven't been back.

data.title: Good chicken, great service
data.text: OK, it's 'fast food', but with a twist. The staff are pleasant, communicative, helpful, and plentiful. The chicken was done well - moist, yet fully cooked, and the sauces are very tasty.

data.title: Small parking lot, trapped by cars on El Camino, quality food, overpriced
data.text:
This Chick Fil A opened October 31, 2013, but I never went there until very recently when they mailed out coupons to the immediate neighborhood.

And it's definitely not because I didn't notice the Chick Fil A!  The restaurant is located on El Camino about 200 feet from the busiest intersection in Sunnyvale -where the 8 lane El Camino Real (6 lanes and 2 left turn lanes) meets the 10 lane Mathilda (6 lanes, 2 left turn lanes, two right turn lanes) at a traffic light intersection.  

The problem is that there is no right turn lane on east bound El Camino Real toward south Mathilda -the only direction on the four corner intersection without a right turn lane.  So traffic in that right lane backs up, and up, well beyond the Chick Fil A., waiting for the light to turn green.  Often you cannot leave the parking lot, until a car on El Camino stops to come into the lot.  

There's only one way into the Chick Fil A parking lot, and one way out, and that's right on that backed up El Camino Real right lane.  So getting in and getting out of the parking lot is a nightmare during eating hours, particularly at dinner time.   And the parking lot itself holds maybe 60 vehicles, while the capacity of the restaurant is in the hundreds.  

The place is clean, crowded, and with fast service.

We walked there from our house, going to the Sunnyvale library first,  and ordered one of their famous or infamous $3.50 spicy chicken sandwiches, and an overpriced $8 Chinese chicken salad.  The salad is good, with chicken and mandarins mixed in with the iceberg lettuce.     

The $3.50 spicy chicken sandwich seems overpriced for what you get - a breaded fillet of chicken on a kaiser roll with lettuce and tomato.  Granted it tastes very good, but $3.50 for a chicken sandwich, when In and Out Hamburgers are $1.80?

They also have a children's play area with various playground equipment right next to the eating area in a separate room, visible from the eating area.

As we leave the restaurant, cars wait to leave the packed parking lot, while an endless stream of cars on El Camino rolls by and comes to a standstill waiting for the light to turn green, trapping the parking lot cars.

And if you are thinking of parking in the Fidelity Investments Parking Lot on Mathilda, two doors down, there is a sign at the entrance stating "No chick-fil-a parking -tow away'.  Chick-fil-a:  Welcome to California!

data.title: Chicken and more chicken!
data.text: Stopped in the other day for chicken, of course. All they have is chicken, but there is a wide variety of items from chicken strips, to chicken salad sandwiches, and even chicken soup. I got the cobb salad and it was very good. A large selection of dressings to choose from. My husband and kids got the strips. Lots of dipping sauces to choose from as well. Very polite servers that constantly check in on you. Not my favorite place for dinner since the menu is so limited, but I will be back for a lunch salad.

data.title: 我們最愛的美式快餐
data.text: 超美味雞堡，連海棉寶寶都會放棄美味蟹堡！我最愛雞肉沙拉，簡單蔬果配上現炸雞塊，美味又健康。雞塊兒童餐份量剛剛好，孩子超愛！招牌雞三明治，調味非常接近臺灣鹹酥雞，加上經典沾醬，完美！
